Comedy Night
Saturday, September 6, 2025
7:00â€¯PM
9:00â€¯PM
Google Calendar
ICS
Join us for a night of laughter at Nona Adventure Park on September 6th! Get ready to enjoy hilarious stand-up performances by talented comedians. This in-person event guarantees a night of fun and entertainment.
Don't miss out on Nona Adventure Park's special Comedy Night Feature: DAD JOKE CHALLENGE! Featuring reigning Dad Joke Champion + a mystery Dad! First to go is determined by the flip of a banana. The audience decides who is funniest. The winner goes on to next month's round and chooses the next challenger. In October, we will crown the SUPREME DAD JOKE CHAMPION!
Plus, enjoy scratch-made pizzas and HAPPY HOUR from 5 pm to close. Sip $6 Margaritas, $14 Pitchers of Sangria, and $5 White Claws, Draft Beers, Daiquiris, Pina Coladas!
Mark your calendars and get ready for a fun and memorable evening!

ICS
Registration:
Sign-up link:
https://shop.nonaadventurepark.com/clubchampionships2025/en-us/home
This is a
member only
event. There is no sign-up fee. Registration must be completed once for each participant. Please include participants
shirt size
in registration so that they may receive an
exclusive
T-Shirt.
Format & Divisions:
Wakeboard
Divisions:
Beginner
Intermediate
Advanced+
Rules:
Seven minute jam session with traditional final. During the seven minute jam riders can only hit certain features depending on their division. Jam is split into three sections. Kickers, Rails, and Features. NO Air tricks will be counted in the jam session. Riders must also adhere to the jam limitations for their division.
Beginner
Jam Sections:
Kickers
: X-L or Small
Features
: Butterbox
Rail
: A-Frame only
Intermediate
Jam Sections:
Kickers
: X-L or Small
Features
: Butterbox:
Rail
: CNB only
Advanced+
Jam Sections:
Kickers
: X-L or Small
Features
: Butterbox
Rail
: Johns Rail only
Division Jam limitations
:
Beginner
:
Kickers
: Spins - Up to frontside 360sÂ  and backside 180s only. One Basic Invert allowed in Run
Air Tricks
: Ollie 180 and 360 both front side and backside. One Air Trick (Only: Railey, Roll, Roll to Revert or Krypt) can be done in the run..
Rails
: Judges Discretion- but nothing over 360
Intermediate
:
Kickers
: Spins â€“ up to Front Side 720s and backside 540s Only. All Basic Inverts, basic blind tricks and 360 inverts without a handle pass are allowed in Run (No handle pass 360 Inverts)
Air Tricks
: Basic Air tricks, Blind Landing Tricks allowed. HS Mobes are only full twisting invert allowed in run. (S-toBlinds are allowed)
Rails
: Judges Discretion
Advanced+
: NO LIMITATIONS
Jam will be calculated by section, and the top two with the greatest totals of each heat will go straight to finals. OR if there is only one heat everyone goes straight to finals. OR if there is a certain number of heats/participants, we will go to LCQs (last-chance qualifiers) to determine the remaining slots.
For the traditional final, riders get two runs. A run is one lap and a L-Kicker or A-Frame hit with NO limitations (except air trick limitations). Judges will take the better run as the riders final score.
Other divisions:
Kneeboarding
Division - Best Trick:
Rules:
7 minute jam. Competitors get as many tries to do their â€œbest trickâ€ as possible in the 7 minute jam period. Winners are determined at the judges' discretion.
Wakeskate
Division - Best Trick:
Rules:
7 minute jam. Competitors get as many tries to do their â€œbest trickâ€ as possible in the 7 minute jam period. Winners are determined at the judges' discretion.
Double
Contest
- Best Run:
Rules:
1 lap & Large kicker or A-Frame hit once both riders are on the water. Judges determine the best run by theme, execution, composition, and difficulty.
Riders are encouraged to come up with a creative theme for their doubles run, and wear an outfit/accessory related to their theme.
Awards:
Splashes Bistro certificates.
$10 for third, $20 for second, and $30 for first per division.
Please reach out to Walker Wyatt at wwyatt@nonaadventurepark.com with any questions.

Registration:
Sign-up link:
https://shop.nonaadventurepark.com/clubchampionships2025/en-us/home
This is a
member only
event. There is no sign-up fee. Registration must be completed once for each participant. Please include participants
shirt size
in registration so that they may receive an
exclusive
T-Shirt.
Format & Divisions:
Wakeboard
Divisions:
Beginner
Intermediate
Advanced+
Rules:
Seven minute jam session with traditional final. During the seven minute jam riders can only hit certain features depending on their division. Jam is split into three sections. Kickers, Rails, and Features. NO Air tricks will be counted in the jam session. Riders must also adhere to the jam limitations for their division.
Beginner
Jam Sections:
Kickers
: X-L or Small
Features
: Butterbox
Rail
: A-Frame only
Intermediate
Jam Sections:
Kickers
: X-L or Small
Features
: Butterbox:
Rail
: CNB only
Advanced+
Jam Sections:
Kickers
: X-L or Small
Features
: Butterbox
Rail
: Johns Rail only
Division Jam limitations
:
Beginner
:
Kickers
: Spins - Up to frontside 360sÂ  and backside 180s only. One Basic Invert allowed in Run
Air Tricks
: Ollie 180 and 360 both front side and backside. One Air Trick (Only: Railey, Roll, Roll to Revert or Krypt) can be done in the run..
Rails
: Judges Discretion- but nothing over 360
Intermediate
:
Kickers
: Spins â€“ up to Front Side 720s and backside 540s Only. All Basic Inverts, basic blind tricks and 360 inverts without a handle pass are allowed in Run (No handle pass 360 Inverts)
Air Tricks
: Basic Air tricks, Blind Landing Tricks allowed. HS Mobes are only full twisting invert allowed in run. (S-toBlinds are allowed)
Rails
: Judges Discretion
Advanced+
: NO LIMITATIONS
Jam will be calculated by section, and the top two with the greatest totals of each heat will go straight to finals. OR if there is only one heat everyone goes straight to finals. OR if there is a certain number of heats/participants, we will go to LCQs (last-chance qualifiers) to determine the remaining slots.
For the traditional final, riders get two runs. A run is one lap and a L-Kicker or A-Frame hit with NO limitations (except air trick limitations). Judges will take the better run as the riders final score.
Other divisions:
Kneeboarding
Division - Best Trick:
Rules:
7 minute jam. Competitors get as many tries to do their â€œbest trickâ€ as possible in the 7 minute jam period. Winners are determined at the judges' discretion.
Wakeskate
Division - Best Trick:
Rules:
7 minute jam. Competitors get as many tries to do their â€œbest trickâ€ as possible in the 7 minute jam period. Winners are determined at the judges' discretion.
Double
Contest
- Best Run:
Rules:
1 lap & Large kicker or A-Frame hit once both riders are on the water. Judges determine the best run by theme, execution, composition, and difficulty.
Riders are encouraged to come up with a creative theme for their doubles run, and wear an outfit/accessory related to their theme.
Awards:
Splashes Bistro certificates.
$10 for third, $20 for second, and $30 for first per division.

Registration:
Sign-up link:
https://shop.nonaadventurepark.com/clubchampionships2025/en-us/home
This is a
member only
event. There is no sign-up fee. Registration must be completed once for each participant. Please include participants
shirt size
in registration so that they may receive an
exclusive
T-Shirt.
Format & Divisions:
Wakeboard
Divisions:
Beginner
Intermediate
Advanced+
Rules:
Seven minute jam session with traditional final. During the seven minute jam riders can only hit certain features depending on their division. Jam is split into three sections. Kickers, Rails, and Features. NO Air tricks will be counted in the jam session. Riders must also adhere to the jam limitations for their division.
Beginner
Jam Sections:
Kickers
: X-L or Small
Features
: Butterbox
Rail
: A-Frame only
Intermediate
Jam Sections:
Kickers
: X-L or Small
Features
: Butterbox:
Rail
: CNB only
Advanced+
Jam Sections:
Kickers
: X-L or Small
Features
: Butterbox
Rail
: Johns Rail only
Division Jam limitations
:
Beginner
:
Kickers
: Spins - Up to frontside 360sÂ  and backside 180s only. One Basic Invert allowed in Run
Air Tricks
: Ollie 180 and 360 both front side and backside. One Air Trick (Only: Railey, Roll, Roll to Revert or Krypt) can be done in the run..
Rails
: Judges Discretion- but nothing over 360
Intermediate
:
Kickers
: Spins â€“ up to Front Side 720s and backside 540s Only. All Basic Inverts, basic blind tricks and 360 inverts without a handle pass are allowed in Run (No handle pass 360 Inverts)
Air Tricks
: Basic Air tricks, Blind Landing Tricks allowed. HS Mobes are only full twisting invert allowed in run. (S-toBlinds are allowed)
Rails
: Judges Discretion
Advanced+
: NO LIMITATIONS
Jam will be calculated by section, and the top two with the greatest totals of each heat will go straight to finals. OR if there is only one heat everyone goes straight to finals. OR if there is a certain number of heats/participants, we will go to LCQs (last-chance qualifiers) to determine the remaining slots.
For the traditional final, riders get two runs. A run is one lap and a L-Kicker or A-Frame hit with NO limitations (except air trick limitations). Judges will take the better run as the riders final score.
Other divisions:
Kneeboarding
Division - Best Trick:
Rules:
7 minute jam. Competitors get as many tries to do their â€œbest trickâ€ as possible in the 7 minute jam period. Winners are determined at the judges' discretion.
Wakeskate
Division - Best Trick:
Rules:
7 minute jam. Competitors get as many tries to do their â€œbest trickâ€ as possible in the 7 minute jam period. Winners are determined at the judges' discretion.
Double
Contest
- Best Run:
Rules:
1 lap & Large kicker or A-Frame hit once both riders are on the water. Judges determine the best run by theme, execution, composition, and difficulty.
Riders are encouraged to come up with a creative theme for their doubles run, and wear an outfit/accessory related to their theme.
Awards:
Splashes Bistro certificates.
$10 for third, $20 for second, and $30 for first per division.
Please reach out to Walker Wyatt at wwyatt@nonaadventurepark.com with any questions.

Self-starter who can work with minimal supervision

Reliable and consistent in providing safe and fun guest experiences
Shift flexibility â€“ able to work varying shifts that include mornings, afternoons, evenings, weekends, and holidays

First Aid certification (or we will provide)

Fitness instruction experience

Must present yourself in a manner that supports and preserves the brand and guiding principles of the company
Participate in site promotional events
Strong stamina and conditioning â€“ You will be working outdoors in varying weather conditions
Able to lift 20-30 lbs regularly, 40-60 lbs occasionally
Flexibility to assist as needed with other park attractions
Other duties as needed, including but not limited to painting, power washing, cleaning, and general site maintenance.
CABLE OPERATORS
Proven work experience on a cable wakeboarding system as an operator/coach is preferred. Must be shift-flexible as Nona Adventure Park is open seven days per week.
Overall Responsibilities Include:
Greet all guests promptly and enthusiastically in a   warm and professional manner
Provide hands-on training to guests on the beginner  and advanced cable courses
Identify and manage risk demonstrating efficient communication skills
Daily check & verification of all   Cable equipment
Maintain proactive safety culture by reporting gear, course, or personal concerns/infractions to management in a timely manner
Ensure all guests are properly outfitted according to safety guidelines
Adhere to company policies, procedures, and technical protocols at all times
Conduct basic repairs as needed to cable rigging system
AQUA PARK LIFEGUARD
Successful candidates will provide our guests with a safe and fun experience on our Aqua Park Inflatables. Candidates must hold a valid lifeguard certification.
Overall Responsibilities Include:
Greet guests with a smile
Review the safety rules at the start of each Aqua Park session
Check life jacket for each guest to ensure proper fit
Facilitate guest entry and exit from the Aqua Park at the beginning/end of each session
Monitor assigned activity to ensure guest safety and enjoyment
Enforce all park rules and procedures ensuring guest safety is a priority
Attend to guests in distress within 30 seconds of detection
Leave each guest with a smile
Clean Park when not occupied with immediate duties

Professionalism; ability to interact with guests in an engaging and pleasant manner
Effective communication skills
Sound judgment and decision-making skills
Attention to detail while promoting a fun work atmosphere
Self-starter who can work with minimal supervision
Physically fit â€“ able to bend, twist, and turn with flexibility, able to stand for long periods of time, walking/running in sand and able to climb on ladders, uneven surfaces, or towers up to 100 feet tall
Reliable and consistent in providing safe and fun guest experiences
Shift flexibility â€“ able to work varying shifts that include mornings, afternoons, evenings, weekends, and holidays
ALL CANDIDATES must provide a current resume, along with relevant work-place references.
